intro: Linaria fruticosa var. littoralis, commonly known as the coastal goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow, tubular flowers that bloom from late winter to early spring. Its succulent leaves are adapted to tolerate saline and arid conditions, making it well-suited for coastal environments. It plays an important role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
